value: Preparing a live set. Just experimenting with instruments, sounds and loops.
mourning my father entails listening to grand-dad

Karuna Sessions is a free-form sunday soundscape stream.
Since Karuna is Sanskrit for compassion, we thrive for empowering each individual, group, collective and ambient to find in our program the opportunity to express themselves in a free-form fashion.

Jazz and soul mix made on a short trip to Montenegro with just 4 albums on my laptop. Sometimes less is more and divides us to unlock more creativity. Hope you will like it and chill as I did. Oneee love!

A man with a bucket.
A man who let go.

A bucket man.

A bucket with a man.
A man in a bucket.

A man with some bucks.
A man without bucks.

A man without a bucket.
A man to let go.

A bucklet.

When the needle hits the groove, and the movement turns to light which in turn moves the speaker, we know that from the feeling to the feet, there is a whole invisible universe in between.
This is the journey that our guest Andrea Passenger brings us through in this 1 hour mixtape prepared for Purizu, and streamed as part of Karuna Sessions #172.
Keep it running...

Mendigos do Brooklyn is an experimental project that started in a basement back in 2017, after a very intense session of all sorts of noise, shoe-gazing and live beat creation, including sounds from violins, guitar, bass, drums and percussion.
This time, Angelo Reale and Andrei Junquilho get together, even if remotely, to bring life to this Karuna Session, named Solidão (which means loneliness in Portuguese), for the edition #171.
Live stream cost: around 2$
ALL I WANT IS WING STOP
ALL I WANT IS WING STOP

We met Rando Arand (c.o.u.g.h) in Tallinn back in 2014 as Karuna 
Sessions. Dude is legit, authentic and kind. We're glad to have him back
 for Purizu this time, with a whole hour of one-of-a-kindness (if that's
 even a thing). Aitah Rando.⁠
We're very honored to have Mr DrummieDave for a show where he presents some of his handpicked tracks released during the last 2022 summer. Thank you DrummieDave!

MAPA, artistic name of Matheus Patriarcha: composer, singer, and guitarist, has just released the single "Moeda da Sorte", a song filled with energy and diversity, a mix of mystical, allegorical and objective perceptions. Influenced by Indie and MPB, his songs bring a message of hope and vivacity, mixing rhythms and electronic music.
We've had the pleasure of meeting Ponccio back in 2017 while we were DBA Tacitera. This time, we're back to him, for an exclusive mix recorded for Purizu. It's been 5 years, but still 1 beat.

We met Niki in Berlin back in 2013. A talented and dedicated kind selector of the finest blends of all things black-disco-funk-soul. He is also going to be playing for us on Purizu's Official Launch here in Sassari next Saturday at The Room. Nice to see you again Niki.
This is Afrokaza. Your host?
alabastro
. Just sit back and relax, cuz this is how we chill.⁠
We're live from the Studios in Sassari for the first Home Session, where your host, Fois will guide you through his soundscapes. Sit back and enjoy the ride!
We're glad to host the More Peas show by James Blake. Thank you sir.⁠
We met dud back in 2017 when he was doing the Intense project in the south region of Brazil, where he joined us for a podcast with Tacitera. Welcome back dud!⁠

Time to launch. We have done well in the last two weeks and are confident that we will leave a positive impact in our home, which is currently Sassari / Sardinia.
As Niki's flight got a bit late, our founder, Reale, jumped into the decks and played some of his vinyls.
Dj and photographer based in San Sebastián. Homie at DBDB Club Nights, her sessions are brightness, full of broken rhythms and enveloping atmospheres.
With a fresh selection of warm sounds and an intuition for creating the right mood, always looking for an emotional space in which to feel and dance.
We met Ope back in 2013, and she still amazes us with her unique sound signature. Expect some solid breaks and some whimsical pads, electronica at its finest. Welcome back Ope!
Instagram
Mixcloud
We welcome Marco Herbert for the second episode of the weekly show from the Spanish reptilians: YACARÉ SESSIONS.
We welcome master Splinter from Salvador with a new show called Intono.

Born in the Brazilian state of Bahia (Salvador de Bahía), Rosenildo Da Silva França, DJ Splinter, started his career in the 80's as resident DJ in the clubs Close-up and Tropicalia, in Salvador, playing disco and house music. Since then he never stopped working as a DJ.
Impromptu Sessions is a pop up show that happens live from our studios in Italy. They don't follow any schedule.⁠

Karuna Sessions is a free-form sunday soundscape stream.
Since Karuna is Sanskrit for compassion, we thrive for empowering each individual, group, collective and ambient to find in our program the opportunity to express themselves in a free-form fashion.

Mau Maioli, artist at Alliance Artists, resident at Levels Sunset, Oben Beer and co-creator of the label party Beat On Me and the record label Levels Rec, performs fundamental work on the dancefloor and in the studio. In addition to his sharp and vast musical research, Mau plays a strong role in the studio where he has releases by Concreta Sala (USA), Warung Recordings, Young Society Records (GER) and Prototype, on this last label he had the honor of receiving a remix by Renato Cohen and supporters by Perel, Local Suicide and Fatnotronic.
We welcome Mary G for her Mistérios da Meia Noite show, with no particular cadence or schedule.
Expect some nice selection of curated grooves, from Gal Costa to Sun-Ra, blended with the finest jazzy-funky-soul beats.

In the construction of his sets, Brooks excels in strong beats filled with striking bass lines, in a walk between house and techno, always with room for more synthetic variations, without abandoning the groove and swing. The script for this film would invariably end in a party, with the artist commanding the sound, doing what he does best: making smiles from the sweaty dance floor.

Charisma, meticulous technique and relaxed behavior are already registered trademarks, recognized by the entire public in the city. Currently, he transmits knowledge by teaching mixing classes and deepening his studies in the production of authorial tracks.
Links:
https://linktr.ee/brooksbr
https://www.instagram.com/brooksbr_

Jamie Renton is a London-based DJ spinning a unique blend of global party sounds: raw funk to roots reggae, blues to hip-hop, the tropics to the Balkans and beyond. He has played at the Glastonbury Festival, Dingwalls, Hootananny, Scala, Gibraltar Music Festival, Jazz Café, The Jago, The Roundhouse, 100 Club and many other fine venues and festivals nationally and internationally. Bringing pure niceness and the hottest grooves wherever he goes.
Instagram
Twitter
Facebook
Mixcloud

Maxwell Simons, electronic producer half Italian half Brazilian, has taken up a wide variety of genres since a very young age: from baile funk to Detroit techno and hard house to hip hop. He soon connected his passion for music to electronic production and started practicing with synths and gears becoming a popular DJ among the local community.

After some years being busy on the scene, playing parties and live shows, the artist decided to study sound engineering at university, refining his practice and expanding his tastes to bass, industrial and rap.

The artist is very interested in both analog and digital techniques, experimenting with samples, filed recordings and either live or virtual instruments. Strong editing skills coming from his job inside tv studios make the difference in manipulating rap vocals and chopping beats.
The results are incredibly futuristic and audacious creations often filtered through graphic imageries that turn sound into an immersive cinematic experience.
Bandcamp
Soundcloud
Instagram
There's no way to build a successful career other than dedicating yourself completely, body and soul, to your dream, and Charlly Roger loves every moment of it.

Hours spent locating and selecting the right music, hours spent planning the structure of the night, and then hours spent putting them into action. Charlly Roger has the ability to combine vision with competence, daring and sophistication. Sometimes slow, sometimes more intense, he works his sets down to the smallest detail to find the perfect way to transform moments shared with the audience into unforgettable experiences.
In times of “more of the same”, he fully lives his authenticity and leaves a little of himself and his passion for music and work in each track.

Restless, persistent, competent, Charlly Roger is always more than happy to spend all his time in his evenings because he takes his profession seriously. And that's exactly what matters most to him. That's the mission he embarked on, with no end in sight.
ResidentAdvisor:
residentadvisor.net/dj/charllyroger
Soundcloud:
soundcloud.com/charllyroger
Facebook:
www.facebook.com/djcharllyroger
We're very honored to have Mr DrummieDave for a show where he presents some of his handpicked tracks for NYE. Thank you DrummieDave!
Born in Berlin 1981, Sascha aka Kid Kosmik, discovered his love for music from an early age and was instantly hooked by the Rock'n'Roll sounds of that era.

Having relocated to the Austrian countryside with his parents at the age of 10, Sascha grew up with Psychedelic Rock, Hard Rock, Punk Rock, Indie Rock, Ska, Raggae and Hip-Hop, as he always had an open mind for different music.
Funnily enough, he had a strong stance regarding electronic music not being "real music". His mind set, however, changed in 2003, when he moved to Vienna and discovered the underground club scene.
After experiencing his first Psytrance festivals, Sascha started DJing Psychedelic Trance in 2004 and soon played at many parties in Vienna and around Austria.

In his beginning years, Sascha performed as "PinkPanther" and was the first DJ at that time, calling his style of music "Deep Psy". With his monthly radio show "Final Fantasy" on Digitally Imported Radio, he was able to share his DJ sets with a broad audience all over the world.

After a break from the Psytrance scene, he changed his DJ name and came back as “Ghost In The Shroom”. From there he appeared on several International Psytrance line-ups of smaller and mid-sized clubs and festivals in Europe, Central America and Goa/India.
In 2017, Sascha moved back to Berlin and rebranded himself, once again, creating "Kid Kosmik".

Kid Kosmik is a multi genre skilled DJ within a variety of sounds, including Minimal, Deep, Dark, Progressive and Psychedelic Techno, Tech House, Deep House, Progressive House, Psychedelic Trance and Downbeat.
Kid Kosmik Links & Social Media

Resident Advisor
Dj, digger, daring, he comes from the sea and is constantly immersed in the contaminations of the moment while looking for old lost records.
He navigates through the sounds of the black universe: jazz, hip hop, funk to name a few.
Once a month he hosts Sunday Brew on the non-frequencies of Radio Banda Larga, a Sunday morning shaker in which he spontaneously shares his musical explorations.
Klouterss is a fresh downtempo duo from France. Their influence are diverse, from ethnic and tribal to industrial sounds. Only one tenet : slow down.
Originally streamed on livetwentyfour7 radio chicago 10 months ago:

According to the Book of Revelation in the New Testament of the Christian Bible, Armageddon (/ˌɑːrməˈɡɛdən/, from Ancient Greek: Ἁρμαγεδών Harmagedōn,[1][2] Late Latin: Armagedōn,[3] from Hebrew: הַר מְגִדּוֹ‎ Har Məgīddō) is the prophesied location of a gathering of armies for a battle during the end times, which is variously interpreted as either a literal or a symbolic location. The term is also used in a generic sense to refer to any end of the world scenario. In Islamic theology, Armageddon is also mentioned in Hadith as the Greatest Armageddon or Al-Malhama Al-Kubra (the great battle).[4]

The "mount" of Megiddo in northern Israel is not actually a mountain, but a tell (a mound or hill created by many generations of people living and rebuilding on the same spot)[5] on which ancient forts were built to guard the Via Maris, an ancient trade route linking Egypt with the northern empires of Syria, Anatolia and Mesopotamia. Megiddo was the location of various ancient battles, including one in the 15th century BC and one in 609 BC. The nearby modern Megiddo is a kibbutz in the Kishon River area.[6]
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Armageddon
